channel.title: hugo on New Linux User
channel.description: Recent content in hugo on New Linux User

item.title: Hugo Static Website on GitHub
item.description: Creating a static website with Hugo and hosting it on GitHub can seem daunting, but I’ll break it down into simple steps that beginners can follow. By the end of this post, you’ll have your static website up and running. Let’s get started: Step 1: Install Hugo First, you need to install Hugo, a popular static site generator. You can download it from the official website at Hugo Themes. Follow the installation instructions for your specific operating system.

item.title: Using Org Mode in Hugo
item.description: Document navigation C-c C-n Move to the next heading C-c C-p Move to the previous heading TAB on a heading will collapse/expand Formatting Emphasis Style Code bold *bold* italics /italics/ literal =literal= link link Blocks Code can be formatted in blocks like this: Where ruby is the language type. You can auto fill out that structure with <sTAB at the beginning of a line. CSS For blocks you can set specifc classes to be added to the html, so for example
